result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Culver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Illegal Voting, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 1:39pm. 
Defendant James A Culver in court with Attorney David Karpe.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the Repeater allegation from the charging language. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest  " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Culver guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Culver to:
--serve 14 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on December 5, 2014 at 7:00pm. 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Culver is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518,  to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 12/15/14 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 20  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given. 
recess 1:53pm.
to Adjourn Hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Proposed stip to adjourn
Note from JA-DA called & VM left for Attorney Karpe ref the need for a stip
Request from Attorney Karpe to reschedule the 10/28/14 Status Conference
Status conference on October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:10am. 
Defendant James A Culver in court with Attorney David Karpe.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Culver waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties recited
--Defense stands mute; plea of "not guilty" entered by the Court on Mr. Culver's behalf
Mr. Culver verifies that the Milwaukee Street address remains current.
recess 10:13am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial on 9/24/14 at 1:00pm. (2) schedule Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
Waiver of Prelim on August 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:51pm. 
Attorney David Karpe appears by telephone.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck indicates that the State is not opposing the Defendant's request to adjourn the Preliminary Hearing set for this coming Monday. 
The Court grants the Defendant's Motion to Adjourn the 8/11/14 Preliminary Hearing.  
recess 1:52pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Wavier of Preliminary Hearing on 8/25/14 at 9:30am.
Motion hearing on August 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Motion to adjourn hearing filed by Attorney Karpe

Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.

case called at 1:08pm. 
Defendant James A Culver in court with Attorney David Karpe.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Karpe verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is accurate.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:10pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/16/14 at 11:20am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing on a date after August 6th
